meanings.definition: A word or phrase at the top of a page in a dictionary or index, indicating the subject or content of the page.
meanings.sent1: The dictionary page had the term 'headwords' at the top.
meanings.sent2: In the index, 'headwords' help find specific information quickly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student replaced all 'headwords' with funny words in the dictionary.
meanings.sent4: Her name was like a 'headword' in the story of our friendship, always present and guiding.
meanings.sent5: Imagine 'headwords' as the gatekeepers of knowledge, opening the doors to new worlds.

meanings.definition: The main word in a dictionary entry, typically shown in bold or capital letters.
meanings.sent1: When you look up a word, the 'headwords' stand out on the page.
meanings.sent2: The 'headwords' make it easy to locate the word you want to know more about.
meanings.sent3: The 'headwords' in the dictionary seemed to be having a party in bold letters.
meanings.sent4: His laughter echoed through the room, the 'headword' of joy in our gathering.
meanings.sent5: Bold and proud, the 'headwords' announce the beginning of a new linguistic adventure.
